content.question: A motor rated with power <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is used to lift an object of weight at constant speed to a height <math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in time <math alttext="t " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The work done in lifting the box is <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. A motor rated with power <math alttext="2 P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is used to lift the same object to the same height <math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in time <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The new work done in lifting the box is <math alttext="W sub 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following claims correctly describes the relationships between the two times and two values of work done and is supported with appropriate reasoning?

choices.label: <math alttext="W sub 2 is greater than W " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mo>></mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2 is less than t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mo><</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the more-powerful motor can do more work and do the work faster.

<math alttext="W sub 2 is greater than W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mo>></mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2 is less than t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mo><</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, because whenever the work is done faster, more work will be done.

<math alttext="W sub 2 equals W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2 is less than t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mo><</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the object is lifted to the same height and the more-powerful motor can do work faster.

<math alttext="W sub 2 is greater than W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mo>></mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2 is less than t " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mo><</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the object is lifted to the same height and the more-powerful motor can do work faster.

<math alttext="W sub 2 is equals to W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2 equals t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the object is lifted to the same height, and the work done and the time to do the work will be the same.

content.answer: <math alttext="W sub 2 equals W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2 is less than t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mo><</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the object is lifted to the same height and the more-powerful motor can do work faster.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
